metadata.title: CVE-2016-7035 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An authorization flaw was found in Pacemaker before 1.1.16, where it didnot properly guard its IPC interface. An attacker with an unprivilegedaccount on a Pacemaker node could use this flaw to, for example, force theLocal Resource Manager daemon to execute a script as root and thereby gainroot access on the machine.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7035` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcib3 - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.4
libcrmcluster4 - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.4
libcrmcommon3 - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.4
libcrmservice1 - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.4
liblrmd1 - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.4
libpe-rules2 - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.4
libpe-status4 - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.4
libpengine4 - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.4
libstonithd2 - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.4
libtransitioner2 - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.4
pacemaker - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.4
pacemaker-cli-utils - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.4
pacemaker-remote - 1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pacemaker package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.10+git20130802-1ubuntu2.4').
